name: unsayable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Unsayable things should not be said because they are too shocking, rude, painful, etc.: He seems determined to say these unsayable things, in spite of the fact that it could be political suicide. Some of the things that happened during the war are unsayable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe answer is very simple and yet, in some places, quite unsayable. He has a capacity for saying things that other politicians would consider completely unsayable. There is a wider, unsayable truth: allowing people to do what they want is generally a recipe for disaster.

the unsayable
something that should not be said because it is too shocking, rude, painful, etc.: say the unsayable He was a confrontational politician, never afraid to say the unsayable. She is one of the best of those writers who seek to capture the unsayable.
